yuidoc.name: yuidoc

DocBuilder.name: DocBuilder
DocBuilder.description:
Takes the `JSON` data from the `DocParser` class, creates and parses markdown and handlebars
based templates to generate static HTML content

CLI.name: CLI
CLI.description: Parses the arguments, creates the options and passes them to `Y.YUIDoc` and then `Y.DocBuilder`.

DocParser.name: DocParser
DocParser.description:
The doc parser accepts a **map** of files to file content.
Once `parse()` is called, various properties will be populated
with the parsers data (aggregated in the `'data'` property).

DocView.name: DocView
DocView.description:
View class borrowed from [Selleck](https://github.com/rgrove/selleck)
The view class is a **`handlebars`** template helper.

params.name: data
params.description: Meta data to use in this template

params.name: templateName
params.description: The name of the template file to render.

Main.name: Main

Server.name: Server
Server.description: Provides the `--server` server option for YUIDoc

YUIDoc.name: YUIDoc

Parses the JSON data and formats it into a nice log string for
filename and line number: `/file/name.js:123`
classitems.name: stringlog

params.name: data
params.description: The data block from the parser

classitems.description: Flatten a string, remove all line breaks and replace them with a token
classitems.name: implodeString

classitems.description: Un-flatten a string, replace tokens injected with `implodeString`
classitems.name: implodeString

classitems.description:
A list of known tags.  This populates a member variable
during initialization, and will be updated if additional
digesters are added.
classitems.name: TAGLIST

classitems.description:
A list of ignored tags. These tags should be ignored because there is
likely to be used for purposes other than JSDoc tags in JavaScript comments.
classitems.name: IGNORE_TAGLIST

classitems.description: Common errors will get scrubbed instead of being ignored.
classitems.name: CORRECTIONS

classitems.description:
A map of the default tag processors, keyed by the
tag name.  Multiple tags can use the same digester
by supplying the string name that points to the
implementation rather than a function.
classitems.name: DIGESTERS

classitems.description:
Digesters process the tag/text pairs found in a
comment block.  They are looked up by tag name.
The digester gets the tagname, the value, the
target object to apply values to, and the full
block that is being processed.  Digesters can
be declared as strings instead of a function --
in that case, the program will try to look up
the key listed and use the function there instead
(it is an alias).  Digesters can return a host
object in the case the tag defines a new key
block type (modules/classes/methods/events/properties)
classitems.name: digesters

classitems.description:
Emitters will be schemas for the types of payloads
the parser will emit.  Not implemented.
classitems.name: emitters

classitems.description: Comment syntax type.
classitems.name: syntaxtype

classitems.description: The map of file names to file content.
classitems.name: filemap

classitems.description:
A map of file names to directory name.  Provided in
case this needs to be used to reset the module name
appropriately -- currently not used
classitems.name: dirmap

classitems.description: The file currently being parsed
classitems.name: currentfile

classitems.description: The main documentation block for the module itself.
classitems.name: mainmodule

classitems.description: The module currently being parsed
classitems.name: currentmodule

classitems.description: The submodule currently being parsed
classitems.name: currentsubmodule

classitems.description: The class currently being parsed
classitems.name: currentclass

classitems.description: Takes a non-namespaced classname and resolves it to a namespace (to support `@for`)
classitems.name: _resolveFor

classitems.description:
Normalizes the initial indentation of the given _content_ so that the first line
is unindented, and all other lines are unindented to the same degree as the
first line. So if the first line has four spaces at the beginning, then all
lines will be unindented four spaces. Ported from [Selleck](https://github.com/rgrove/selleck)
classitems.name: unindent

classitems.description:
Transforms a JavaDoc style comment block (less the start and end of it)
into a list of tag/text pairs. The leading space and '*' are removed,
but the remaining whitespace is preserved so that the output should be
friendly for both markdown and html parsers.
classitems.name: handlecomment

params.name: file
params.description: The file it was parsed from

params.name: line
params.description: The line number it was found on

classitems.description:
Accepts a map of filenames to file content.  Returns
a map of filenames to an array of API comment block
text.  This expects the comment to start with / **
on its own line, and end with * / on its own
line.  Override this function to provide an
alternative comment parser.
classitems.name: extract

params.name: filemap
params.description: A map of filenames to file content

params.name: dirmap
params.description: A map of file names to directory name

return.description:
A map of filenames to an array of extracted
comment text.

classitems.description: Processes all the tags in a single comment block
classitems.name: processblock

classitems.description:
Transforms a map of filenames to arrays of comment blocks into a
JSON structure that represents the entire processed API doc info
and relationships between elements for the entire project.
classitems.name: transform

params.name: commentmap
params.description: The hash of files and parsed comment blocks

return.description: The transformed data for the project

classitems.description: Extracts and transforms the filemap provided to constructor
classitems.name: parse

params.name: filemap
params.description: A map of filenames to file content

params.name: dirmap
params.description: A map of file names to directory name

return.description:
this parser instance.  The total results
are available in parser.data.

Copy a directory from one location to another

params.description:
Whether or not to overwrite destination files
    if they already exist.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to be executed when complete.

classitems.description: Copy a file from one location to another
classitems.name: copyFile

params.name: overwrite
params.description:
Whether or not to overwrite destination files
    if they already exist.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to be executed when complete.

classitems.description:
If _source_ is a file, copies it to _dest_. If it's a directory, recursively
copies it and all files and directories it contains to _dest_.

Note that when attempting to copy a file into a directory, you should specify
the full path to the new file (including the new filename). Otherwise, it will
be interpreted as an attempt to copy the _source_ file *over* the _dest_
directory instead of *into* it.

Known issues:
- Doesn't preserve ownership or permissions on copied files/directories.
classitems.name: copyPath

params.name: overwrite
params.description:
Whether or not to overwrite destination files
if they already exist.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute when completed.

classitems.description:
If _path_ is a file, deletes it. If _path_ is a directory, recursively deletes
it and all files and directories it contains.

This method is synchronous.
classitems.name: deletePath

classitems.description: Check to see if this is a directory
classitems.name: isDirectory

return.description: True if it is a directory

classitems.description: Check to see if this is a File
classitems.name: isFile

return.description: True if it is a file

classitems.description: Check to see if this is a SymLink
classitems.name: isSymbolicLink

return.description: True if it is a link

classitems.description:
Like `fs.lstatSync()`, but returns `null` instead of throwing when _path_
doesn't exist. Will still throw on other types of errors.
classitems.name: lstatSync

classitems.description:
Like `fs.statSync()`, but returns `null` instead of throwing when _path_
doesn't exist. Will still throw on other types of errors.
classitems.name: statSync

classitems.description: Copy the theme assets directory
classitems.name: copyAssets

params.name: deleteFirst
params.description: Should the directory be deleted if it exists

Like `getPages()`, but returns only the files under the `layout/` subdirectory
of the specified _dir_.

return.description: Mapping of layout names to layout content.

classitems.description: Loads and returns the content of the specified page file.

return.description: Page content, or `null` if not found.

classitems.description:
Loads pages (files with a `.handlebars` extension) in the specified directory and
returns an object containing a mapping of page names (the part of the filename)
preceding the `.handlebars` extension) to page content.

return.description: Mapping of page names to page content.

classitems.description:

classitems.description:
Produces a normalized web path by joining all the parts and normalizing the
filesystem-like path into web compatible url.
Supports relative and absolute paths.
Courtesy of [Mojito's utils](https://github.com/yahoo/mojito/)

params.name: url
params.description: the list of parts to be joined and normalized
